messages.subject: Re: Perfect Parent?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/2/2005 3:29:05 PM Eastern Standard Time, UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes: ... Thanks for this, Ann. I think we need this kind
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/2/2005 3:29:05 PM Eastern Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:

On May 2, 2005, at 6:49 AM, Ann wrote:

> even if we don't always respond the way we wish we had, I have found
> them to be very understanding and forgiving. I think that any parent
> that is conscientiously striving for an unschooling lifestyle is going
> to do a great job caring for their kids.

Thanks for this, Ann. I think we need this kind of encouragement,
sometimes - some of us are so perfectionistic that we feel really
terrible when we don't live up 100 percent to our very lofty goals.

-pam




***********************

"There's no way to be a perfect mother
and a million ways to be a good one."
Jill Churchill



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
